comments.author: Sarah
comments.content: we're getting some fantastic mushrooms at the market....thanks for posting this, i've been needing some inspiration! looks perfect for a busy weeknight.

comments.author: Cara
comments.content: I love lentils, and this Spanish spin sounds particularly delicious!

comments.author: Chef Debbie
comments.content: Michael, I can't wait to try this! I'm seriously thinking of putting my clients on a "meatless Monday" program and this would be a perfect introduction!

comments.author: Alessandra
comments.content:
Meatless Monday! Great start to the week Chef Debbie!!

Nice lentil recipe Michael, I love lentils and mushrooms, although I tend to use the dried porcini only usually. I must try this sometimes.

comments.author: Zia Elle
comments.content: I love lentils, I like your recipe!!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: What a great idea to give your clients Meatless Mondays!

comments.author: Kendra
comments.content: This looks delicious, I don't cook lentils often though. It says "Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook until tender", aprox how long is "until tender"?

comments.author: B.
comments.content: I'm another person who is new to cooking with French lentils.  Will the lentils absorb all of the liquid, or do we drain them, like pasta?

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: @Kendra - I'd start checking every 5 minutes after they have simmered for 20, but it can really vary depending on how dry the lentils are.

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: @B - You want to keep them in enough liquid that they don't scorch, then drain them. (And if you ever scorch beans or lentils, just throw them out - nothing can recover that flavor).

comments.author: B.
comments.content: Thanks, Michael.  I know what I'll be having for dinner tonight!

comments.author: Shelly King
comments.content: Hi! I just discovered your blog. Awesome! I've been thinking about going veggie for a while now. Then I started dating a vegetarian, and he's inspired me. I stumbled on this recipe while googling for lentils and mushrooms. I tried it last night. Super easy and so very yummy! Served it last night with a lovely cucumber salad. Thanks for doing this blog. I'm really enjoying it.

comments.author: Radhika
comments.content: Hi there, just found your blog, what a great space! Everything looks delicious, cant wait to try it all!

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content: Thanks Shelly! I'm delighted you made it and liked it, and I really appreciate you taking the time to drop a note. Makes my day.

comments.author: Tara
comments.content: This looks so delicious. My mouth is watering.  I will most certainly be making this. Yum!

comments.author: Ellen Allard @ I Am Gluten Free
comments.content: You nailed it. There is nothing like a baby bella mushroom quartered and added to a recipe like yours. It's meaty as all get out. Love it!

comments.author: Lorin
comments.content: Yummy!  I need to do more investigation of the difference between one type of lentil and another. :)

comments.author: Teresa
comments.content: Hi there! I just found this and gave it a go! It was fantastic! Thank you so much for the recipe, it was instantly one of my favorites and I'll be making it again soon! http://sw88tpea.blogspot.com/2011/01/new-cookin-with-lentils.html

comments.author: MonaVie
comments.content: I am definitely trying this out. I love mushrooms and would love to see how it would turn up for me with the lentils. Thanks

comments.author: Allison
comments.content: This is amazing!  I live in Korea where sherry vinegar simply does not exist. Is there a good substitution? Could I use apple vinegar instead??

comments.author: Michael Natkin
comments.content:
Hey Allison - I don't see any reason why apple vinegar wouldn't be nice in this dish. Or red wine vinegar if that is available. If you try it, let me know what you think!


Thanks,
Michael

comments.author: Allison
comments.content: The meal turned out really well with apple cider vinegar.  I also added a lot of hot sauce just for the kick.  Thanks for the awesome recipe!

comments.author: Mrs Ergül
comments.content: I made this twice in a matter of few days. We loved it. In fact, I had just posted about it on my blog today. Love the meatiness of the mushrooms without actually eating meat.

comments.author: Berkeley Tapas
comments.content: Garlic, olive oil, sherry vinegar and paprika... You're speaking our language! These lentils look positively delicious, especially with the umami that mushrooms bring. The photo is absolutely mouth-watering!
